items.whyWrong: In electron-transfer redox, reduction is gain of electrons.
items.correctGuidance: Use OILRIG: Reduction Is Gain (of electrons).

items.whyWrong: In electron-transfer redox, oxidation is loss of electrons.
items.correctGuidance: Use OILRIG: Oxidation Is Loss (of electrons).

items.whyWrong: Acid + metal produces hydrogen gas, not water.
That’s the oxygen test; hydrogen gives a squeaky pop with a lit splint.
items.correctGuidance: Hydrogen test: lit splint → squeaky pop.

items.pattern: Oxidation means the metal loses oxygen.
items.whyWrong: In oxygen-transfer terms, oxidation is gain of oxygen.
items.correctGuidance: Oxidation (oxygen-transfer) = gain oxygen; reduction = loss oxygen.

items.whyWrong: That is not balanced as written for Group 1 metals with water.

items.pattern: Zinc + iron chloride --> iron chloride + zinc
items.whyWrong: That keeps the same substances; displacement swaps the metal in the salt.
items.correctGuidance: Zinc + iron chloride --> zinc chloride + iron.
